content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-049-12-B |Item_parent=Normal and pathological puberty |Item_parent_short=Normal and pathological puberty |Rank=B |Title=Understanding the epidemiology of precocious puberty |Description=None |Rubric=Epidemiology |Contributors= |Order=12}} Precocious puberty is much more often central, and much more frequent in girls than in boys (approximately 1000 central precocious puberties in France per year in girls, and 100 in boys). Precocious puberty is most often idiopathic in girls and organic in boys.

question.question: What is the typical gender distribution of central precocious puberty in France?
question.option_a: Central precocious puberty is more common in boys than in girls, with a ratio of 5:1.
question.option_b: Central precocious puberty is more common in girls than in boys, with a ratio of 10:1.
question.option_c: Central precocious puberty is equally common in both boys and girls.
question.option_d: Central precocious puberty is more common in boys than in girls, but only in certain regions of France.
